TopicTitle: [1.0] KerbPaint - Paint layering for parts (March 30th, 2016) Community Update

Articles.Content: But you shuld add spaceplane plus and B9 aerospace mod support.

But you shuld add spaceplane plus and B9 aerospace mod support.

i was just about to say that, especily space plane plus awesome mod

Hey guys, sorry I've been gone so long, home and job probelms. I'm going to take your advice and start up a new thread so my additions are easier to find. I will probably do B9, D12, and spaceplane plus as I get time but most of what I did for LLL is now trash due to the updated models he made. Also, I've somehow lost access to my mediafire account and so had to set up a new one. As soon as I have made some progress, probably on SPP, I'll post the new thread.

Anyone happen to have a working setup that allows kerbpaint on Procedural Dynamics' procedural control surface? Right now the only things supported are the basic wings. (I'd like to be able to make my control surfaces fit in with the painted wings.)

I will probably do B9, D12, and spaceplane plus as I get time but most of what I did for LLL is now trash due to the updated models he made. Also, I've somehow lost access to my mediafire account and so had to set up a new one. As soon as I have made some progress, probably on SPP, I'll post the new thread.

That's pretty much needed yeah

i was just about to say that, especily space plane plus awesome mod

I actually have been working on adding support for SP+, but B9 is one of the worst plane mods for us advanced users.......So I'm not going to add B9 support sadly.

This.

<sipped image>

When this gets fixed I'm all in. I don't know how the rest of you stand it. It's definitely not by being ADHD. That's not it.

Please, I'm more ADHD then a box of squirrels on a gallon of caffeine, and I find that bug bloody hilarious and amazing

Does this still work in .24.2?

if so remind me how to install it (the updated version with ability to paint structural panels)

It's pretty simple, just install it like any other addon. I would suggest not using a mod manager to install it though. I used one a while back and it tended to install the mod, but not install all the files that it did not recognize due to the part masks not having a file extension. all other additional packs can be installed much the same way if you match the directory structure. It still works though, as far as I can tell. It just lacks configurations for all the more recent additions to the stock parts and, of course, the majority of mod parts.

Ok I just downloaded Stock add-on V4 on page 30 and put that file into the game data file. It still is not working.

Never mind. I got it working again.

But it wasn't as simple as you said

I had to download Stock add-on V4 and put that in the game data file then download the original kerbpaint on page 1 and put that in the plugin file

thanks anyway.

Edited August 21, 2014 by Manwith Noname
Changed link to V1.1 SP+
Is There a LLL (Lack Luster Labs) Support out yet? How do i install more Supported Parts?

Thanks Manwith, we're always happy to see people helping out. I would suggest creating a new thread for your addons like I'm going to with a link back to here. I've had no time to work on this due to a move so its nice to see someone made progress, and that nothing broke with the .24 update. Did you do all of the SPP parts? Are you interested in providing support for more mods? If you do start another thread, remember to include links to each of the mods you have created a compatibility patch for.

mJrA: Right now, LLL is not supported, I was working on a patch for it, but then he made those new awesome models which made all the maps I made worthless. I'll get back to that eventually. To install new part patches open up the zip file, if inside that file there is a gamedata folder, simply merge that folder with your ksp gamedata folder

Wow, i didn't see that, sorry and thank you!

Wow, i didn't see that, sorry and thank you!

No worries. If it works for you, post some screenshots and thank Manwith Noname for busting that out for you.

So, I noticed this is now compatible with "Spaceplane Plus." Good stuff... except... one little teeny tiny problem. Lit windows. As in, they don't light up anymore. This is the same problem that I encountered when trying to make the B9 cockpits work with this stuff, LLL as well has this problem. It seems the shader completely disrupts the window emissions. I remember there was a fix a while back, but I'm way too lazy to search all 38 posts for that reference.

BTW: I found that the version of ModuleManager included with the SP+ Kerbpaint addon interferes with the control surface tweakables of FAR. It removed the Flap/Spoiler/ControlMax tweakable options that FAR adds.

Deleting the SP+/Kerbpaint ModuleManager dll returned things to normal.
